Name: Lake Louise
Description: Iconic turquoise glacial lake in Banff National Park. One of the most photographed lakes in Canada and the world, surrounded by mountains and glaciers.

Name: Moraine Lake
Description: Stunning glacial lake in the Valley of the Ten Peaks. One of the most photographed places in Canada, famous for its brilliant blue-green water.

Name: Athabasca Falls
Description: Powerful waterfall on the Athabasca River in Jasper National Park. One of the most photographed waterfalls in Alberta.

Name: Vancouver Skyline
Description: Stunning skyline with mountains and ocean backdrop. One of the most photographed cityscapes in British Columbia.

Name: Capilano Suspension Bridge
Description: Famous suspension bridge over Capilano River. One of the most photographed landmarks in Vancouver, British Columbia.

Name: Butchart Gardens
Description: World-famous gardens with stunning floral displays. One of the most photographed gardens in Canada.

Name: Polar Bear Capital
Description: Churchill, known as the polar bear capital of the world. One of the most photographed wildlife destinations in Manitoba.

Name: Hopewell Rocks
Description: Famous flowerpot rocks shaped by tidal erosion. One of the most photographed natural landmarks in New Brunswick.

Name: Gros Morne National Park
Description: Stunning fjords and dramatic landscapes. One of the most photographed national parks in Newfoundland and Labrador.

Name: ICEBERG ALLEY
Description: Famous route where icebergs drift south. One of the most photographed natural phenomena in Newfoundland and Labrador.

Name: Peggy's Cove
Description: Iconic lighthouse on granite rocks. One of the most photographed lighthouses in Canada and a symbol of Nova Scotia.

Name: Cabot Trail
Description: Famous coastal drive through Cape Breton Highlands. One of the most photographed scenic drives in Nova Scotia.

Name: Nahanni National Park
Description: Remote wilderness with Virginia Falls. One of the most photographed wilderness areas in Northwest Territories.

Name: Northern Lights Viewing
Description: Prime location for viewing the aurora borealis. One of the most photographed natural phenomena in Nunavut.

Name: Niagara Falls
Description: World-famous waterfall on the US-Canada border. One of the most photographed waterfalls in the world and Ontario's top attraction.

Name: CN Tower
Description: Iconic 553-meter tower in Toronto. One of the most photographed landmarks in Canada and a symbol of Toronto.

Name: Thousand Islands
Description: Stunning archipelago in the St. Lawrence River. One of the most photographed scenic areas in Ontario.

Name: Gables House
Description: Famous Green Gables house from Anne of Green Gables. One of the most photographed historic sites in Prince Edward Island.

Name: Old Quebec
Description: UNESCO World Heritage site with European charm. One of the most photographed historic districts in Canada.

Name: Notre-Dame Basilica
Description: Stunning Gothic Revival basilica in Montreal. One of the most photographed churches in Quebec.

Name: Grasslands National Park
Description: Vast prairie with dark sky preserve. One of the most photographed prairie landscapes in Saskatchewan.

Name: Kluane National Park
Description: Home to Canada's highest peak, Mount Logan. One of the most photographed wilderness areas in Yukon.
